page.title: 16The Lie of the Land
page.content:
Wybunbury is situated on the Cheshire Plain.The surrounding countryside is relatively flat and level, with one or two slight undulations.
The river Waldron, which is also known locally as the Checkley Brook, runs through a valley to the North of the village. The Waldron is a tributary of the river Weaver. for its length the Waldron flows through sandy type soil.
Generally the surrounding countryside is open, with wooded areas and farms scattered around the village.A number of farms are under the ownership of the Co-operative Society.
The prescence of sand has led to some quarrying activity and the mounds of the workings can be seen.
